titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Illuminati Club records 1977.202
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:44:46 +0000.

did.abstract: This collection includes various materials documenting the activities of the Illuminati Club during the period 1918 to 1950. Items include constitutions and bylaws, minute books and membership lists, correspondence, event programs and announcement cards, clippings, poetry, and a miniature cloth American flag.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Illuminati Club was a Brooklyn women's cultural organization that was active from 1908 to 1950.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes various materials documenting the activities of the Illuminati Club during the period 1918 to 1950. Items include constitutions and bylaws, minute books and membership lists, correspondence, event programs and announcement cards, clippings, poetry, and a miniature cloth American flag.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Illuminati Club records, 1977.202, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. Thurston C. Bassett, date unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.
